articles.author: Abd Elaziz El7or
articles.description:
What if AI didn‚Äôt just chat‚Äîbut actually opened your browser, wrote your report, designed your logo, and sent the email‚Ä¶ all by itself?

That‚Äôs the bold promise of Manus AI‚Äîand I had to try it.
I recently discovered Manus, an ambitious autonomous AI agent launched in March‚ÄØ2025. Unlike typical bots that only chat, Manus can plan and execute multi-step tasks: it reads websites, writes code, simulates environments, designs visuals, and more‚Äîall without constant supervision (manusai.io, en.wikipedia.org).
Tool‚Äëcalling & independent execution: Manus interacts with a browser, CLI, files, and even image-generators‚Äîfinishing tasks end‚Äëto‚Äëend, not just sketching solutions (manusai.io).
State‚Äëof‚Äëthe‚Äëart GAIA benchmark results: It reportedly surpasses models like OpenAI DeepResearch‚Äîhumans score ~92%, GPT‚Äë4 plugins ~15%, and Manus reportedly hits ~86‚Äì90% (manusai.io).
Integrated visuals: It can generate images (e.g. logos, mockups) within context-based workflows‚Äîlike branding a food truck‚Äîrather than serving one-off art (techradar.com).

Opinions are mixed:
Praise: ‚ÄúThe most impressive AI tool I‚Äôve ever tried‚Ä¶ could eliminate the need for coding as we know it‚Äù (businessinsider.com).
Critiques: Users report slowness, task failures, and that credit costs can add up quickly .
Manus is still invite‚Äëonly. A waitlist is active, but invites are rare (reuters.com).
‚û°Ô∏è If you've ever wanted AI that actually does things‚Äîplans, executes, integrates visuals‚Äîwithout babysitting, Manus is worth exploring.
if you use my invite link, we both get credits to get started faster:
üéÅ Want to try Manus AI for free?

Use my invite link and we‚Äôll both get credits to explore its full power:

üëâüëâ https://manus.im/invitation/Y28BAHOA6WTI üëàüëà



Strengths
Weaknesses




Full task planning & execution
Slow & sometimes unstable


Integrated visuals & docs
Credit‚Äëheavy & warranty limits


Outperforms standard agents
Privacy & invite constraints



businessinsider.com
techradar.com
businessinsider.com
articles.title: I Tried Manus AI ‚Äî The "Do-Everything" Agent Everyone's Talking About

Need translation software for eLearning development? We also discuss the features you should look for in translation software for eLearning, as well as a specific suggestion for the software you should be using to translate your online course offerings.

articles.author: Rocktim M
articles.description:
The technology world continues to evolve at an unprecedented pace, and DevOps is right at the center of this transformation. What started as a set of cultural practices to bridge the gap between development and operations has now become a critical engine for innovation and business success. 
But while some organizations have soared ahead with continuous delivery and lightning-fast deployments, others remain stuck‚Äîheld back by cultural inertia, skills gaps, and legacy challenges.
As we head into 2025, staying competitive means understanding the trends shaping the DevOps landscape‚Äîand knowing how to turn them into opportunities. 
At Zopdev, we believe DevOps is more than a set of tools or practices; it‚Äôs the foundation for building scalable, reliable, and secure software. Let‚Äôs dive into the‚Ä¶
articles.title: DevOps Trends to Watch in 2025

articles.author: Latchu@DevOps
articles.description:
üéØ Goal: Learn what Trunk-Based Development is and how to use it using a very basic HTML project (myshop-demo).
üí° No big branches. No long pull requests. Just fast commits to main ‚Äî like a continuous conveyor belt of improvements.
Everyone works in one branch, usually main, and commits small, frequent changes.
Optionally, short-lived feature branches (1‚Äì2 hours max) are used and merged quickly.



** ‚úÖ Pros
‚ùå Caution  **




Simple, fast, and clean
Risky without automated testing


Great for CI/CD & small teams
Requires discipline (no broken code)


Ideal for feature flags & toggles
Not for teams with slow release cycles



Let‚Äôs say you want to:
Add a message: ‚ÄúWelcome Offer: 10% Off‚Äù
Add a wishlist button (optional toggle)
Instead of creating feature branches, we‚Äôll do everything in mai‚Ä¶
articles.title: üß± Trunk-Based Development ‚Äî The Easiest Git Example You'll Ever See

articles.author: Sharon
articles.description:
If you've ever read the OWASP Top 10, you already know the most common web vulnerabilities‚Äîlike SQL injection, XSS, and broken access controls. But in the real world, attacks don‚Äôt stop there. Hackers often chain multiple techniques, exploit business logic, or use automated tools to bypass traditional defenses.
This is where a Web Application Firewall (WAF) becomes essential.
The OWASP Top 10 is an industry-standard awareness document that highlights the most critical web application security risks. It‚Äôs a great foundation for secure development and testing, but it's not enough on its own. Real-world attackers rarely limit themselves to these 10 items.
Some examples:
A01: Broken Access Control

Attackers bypass weak session rules to access admin panels.


A03: Injection

SQL injection payl‚Ä¶
articles.title: OWASP Top 10 Is Just the Start: How WAFs Defend Against Real Attacks

üéØ Use Case: You want to support two different versions of your web app ‚Äî one for existing users (v1), and another for upcoming features (v2). üõí Scenario: Version 1 (release/v1) is live, stable, and used by customers. Version 2 (release/v2) is under development with a new UI. Your task: Add a new UI message in v2 Apply a hotfix in v1 Without affecting each other ‚úÖ Step 1: Initialize the Project (if not already) mkdir myshop-demo cd myshop-demo git init echo "

Welcome to MyShop

articles.author: KingswayVideo
articles.description:
How to Create and Submit a Sitemap for Your Independent Website
If your independent website has a large number of product pages, videos, industry news articles, and more‚Äîand you want them to be indexed and ranked faster and more effectively by search engines‚Äîyou can submit a sitemap to help search engines better crawl and index your content. This can boost your site‚Äôs visibility and attract more potential visitors.
What Is a Sitemap?
XML sitemaps are designed for search engines, not human visitors, and cannot be seen by users browsing your website.
There are four main types of sitemaps:
General XML Sitemap
Better Discoverability: XML sitemaps help search engines find important pages on your site‚Äîespecially useful for large websites with thousands of pages that may be subject to limited crawl budgets.
This updates automatically when pages are published or updated.
For more control and customization, use a plugin like Yoast SEO:
Log into WordPress Dashboard
You cannot manually choose which pages to include.
Squarespace
Kingsway Video.
All videos uploaded to Kingsway Video are automatically added to a video sitemap.
Open Google Search Console
Log in to Google Search Console
Select your domain property from the dropdown in the upper-left corner
Go to the ‚ÄúSitemaps‚Äù Section
In the left-hand sidebar, under Index, click Sitemaps
Submit Your Sitemap
Paste the URL of your sitemap or video sitemap into Add a new sitemap
Click Submit
‚úÖ You‚Äôll receive a confirmation that your sitemap has been submitted successfully.
üìÖ Check back after a few hours or days to see if the status updates to Success.
How to Delete and Resubmit a Sitemap
Log into Google Search Console
Only includes URLs that:
https://example.com/page)
https://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9)
Contains language/region variants where applicable
Linked from robots.txt file:
This helps search engines find your sitemap faster.
articles.title: How to create and use a site map Ôºü

articles.author: Sindhuja N.S
articles.description:
In the world of modern IT, speed, consistency, and scalability are key to maintaining a competitive edge. That‚Äôs where Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) Automation with Ansible comes into play. This powerful combination helps organizations automate complex processes, reduce human errors, and accelerate innovation‚Äîwhile maintaining system stability and security.
üöÄ What Is Red Hat Ansible Automation?
When paired with Red Hat Enterprise Linux, Ansible delivers a highly reliable and scalable automation solution optimized for enterprise environments.
Key Features of RHEL Automation with Ansible
Simple Playbook Syntax
Security and Compliance
Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
Integration with RHEL Insights
üí° Use Cases in Real-World IT Environments
Security Hardening: Enforce CIS benchmarks and automate patch deployment.
Application Deployment: Deploy enterprise applications consistently across multiple servers.
Multi-tier Automation: Automate complete stack‚Äîfrom database setup to front-end deployment‚Äîin one playbook.
üìà Business Benefits
‚úÖ Improved Uptime ‚Äì Automated recovery and configuration reduce system downtime.
‚úÖ Enhanced Agility ‚Äì Quickly roll out updates, patches, and new configurations across environments.
‚úÖ Risk Mitigation ‚Äì Consistent and repeatable processes reduce human errors and compliance violations.
Getting Started
Ansible Tower ‚Äì a web UI and REST API for managing Ansible projects
Automation Hub ‚Äì pre-built, certified content from Red Hat and partners
Automation Analytics ‚Äì insights into automation performance and ROI
To start automating your RHEL environments, explore Red Hat‚Äôs learning portal and try hands-on labs.
‚ú® Conclusion
Whether you're just starting with automation or scaling across your organization, Ansible and RHEL together provide a future-ready foundation for modern IT.
For more info, Kindly follow: Hawkstack Technologies
articles.title: üîß Red Hat Enterprise Linux Automation with Ansible: Streamline IT Operations Like Never Before
